Vegetables.name: asparagus
Vegetables.storage: Refrigerate upright in a jar with water, loosely covered.
Vegetables.notes: Asparagus is a spring vegetable known for its tender spears and grassy flavor, often served steamed or grilled.

Vegetables.name: avocado
Vegetables.storage: Store at room temperature until ripe, then refrigerate.
Vegetables.notes: Avocados are creamy, nutrient-rich fruits used in salads, spreads, and dips like guacamole.

Vegetables.name: beet
Vegetables.storage: Refrigerate in a breathable bag with tops trimmed.
Vegetables.notes: Beets are earthy-tasting root vegetables commonly used in salads, juices, and roasted dishes.

Vegetables.name: bell pepper
Vegetables.storage: Store in the refrigerator crisper drawer.
Vegetables.notes: Bell peppers are sweet, crunchy vegetables available in various colors and used raw or cooked in many dishes.

Vegetables.name: broccoli
Vegetables.storage: Refrigerate in a breathable bag or container.
Vegetables.notes: Broccoli is a cruciferous vegetable with edible green florets and stalks, commonly cooked or eaten raw.

Vegetables.name: brussels sprout
Vegetables.storage: Store in a sealed container in the fridge.
Vegetables.notes: Brussels sprouts are small leafy green buds often roasted or sautéed, known for their bold flavor.

Vegetables.name: cabbage
Vegetables.storage: Keep in crisper drawer wrapped or in a bag.
Vegetables.notes: Cabbage is a leafy vegetable with a dense head, used raw in slaws or cooked in soups and sautés.

Vegetables.name: carrot
Vegetables.storage: Refrigerate in a crisper drawer or container.
Vegetables.notes: Carrots are crunchy, sweet root vegetables widely used raw in salads or cooked in many dishes.

Vegetables.name: cauliflower
Vegetables.storage: Keep in a perforated bag in the fridge.
Vegetables.notes: Cauliflower is a white, cruciferous vegetable often eaten roasted, steamed, or riced as a grain alternative.

Vegetables.name: celery
Vegetables.storage: Wrap in foil or store in water in the fridge.
Vegetables.notes: Celery is a crunchy, watery vegetable commonly used as a base in soups and stews or eaten raw as a snack.

Vegetables.name: corn
Vegetables.storage: Refrigerate with husks on, use quickly for best flavor.
Vegetables.notes: Corn is a starchy vegetable often eaten on the cob or as loose kernels, sweet and versatile in dishes.

Vegetables.name: cucumber
Vegetables.storage: Refrigerate unpeeled for best freshness.
Vegetables.notes: Cucumbers are cool, watery vegetables used fresh in salads or pickled as a condiment.

Vegetables.name: eggplant
Vegetables.storage: Store in a cool, dry place; avoid refrigeration.
Vegetables.notes: Eggplants are spongy, purple vegetables often used in Mediterranean and Asian cuisines.

Vegetables.name: garlic
Vegetables.storage: Store whole bulbs in a dry, cool, dark place.
Vegetables.notes: Garlic is a pungent allium used for flavoring dishes around the world, available fresh or in processed forms.

Vegetables.name: green beans
Vegetables.storage: Keep in a plastic bag in the refrigerator.
Vegetables.notes: Green beans are slender, crunchy pods that are eaten whole, commonly cooked or served in salads.

Vegetables.name: jalapeno pepper
Vegetables.storage: Refrigerate in a produce bag or container.
Vegetables.notes: Jalapeños are moderately hot chili peppers used in salsas, sauces, and as toppings.

Vegetables.name: kale
Vegetables.storage: Store in a bag with a paper towel in the fridge.
Vegetables.notes: Kale is a dark leafy green high in fiber and nutrients, often used in salads or cooked side dishes.

Vegetables.name: leek
Vegetables.storage: Wrap in plastic or store uncut in fridge.
Vegetables.notes: Leeks are mild-flavored alliums with a long white stalk and green leaves, often used in soups and braises.

Vegetables.name: lettuce
Vegetables.storage: Keep dry in a sealed container with paper towel.
Vegetables.notes: Lettuce is a leafy vegetable used primarily in salads and sandwiches, available in several varieties.

Vegetables.name: mushrooms
Vegetables.storage: Keep in paper bag or breathable container in fridge.
Vegetables.notes: Mushrooms are edible fungi used in savory dishes for their umami flavor and meaty texture.

Vegetables.name: onion
Vegetables.storage: Store whole in a cool, dark place.
Vegetables.notes: Onions are a foundational aromatic vegetable used in countless savory dishes around the world.

Vegetables.name: yellow onion
Vegetables.storage: Store in a cool, dark pantry away from potatoes.
Vegetables.notes: Yellow onions are the most common cooking onion, with a balance of pungency and sweetness.

Vegetables.name: white onion
Vegetables.storage: Store in a cool, dry place away from light.
Vegetables.notes: White onions are sharper in flavor than yellow onions and are often used in Latin cuisine.

Vegetables.name: red onion
Vegetables.storage: Store in a cool, dark pantry away from moisture.
Vegetables.notes: Red onions are often used raw in salads and sandwiches for their color and mild sharpness.

Vegetables.name: sweet onion
Vegetables.storage: Refrigerate for best freshness; use quickly after cutting.
Vegetables.notes: Sweet onions have low sulfur content and a mellow flavor, ideal for raw or lightly cooked dishes.

Vegetables.name: green onion
Vegetables.storage: Store in the fridge wrapped in a damp paper towel or upright in water.
Vegetables.notes: Green onions are slender alliums with white bulbs and long green stalks, used raw or lightly cooked for garnish and flavor.

Vegetables.name: scallion
Vegetables.storage: Wrap in paper towel and store in a produce bag in the fridge.
Vegetables.notes: Scallions are a type of immature onion used for their mild flavor and crunchy texture in both raw and cooked dishes.

Vegetables.name: spring onion
Vegetables.storage: Store in the fridge in a plastic bag or cup of water.
Vegetables.notes: Spring onions have a stronger bulb than green onions but are still mild; they’re used fresh or grilled whole.

Vegetables.name: shallot
Vegetables.storage: Store in a cool, dark, dry place like regular onions.
Vegetables.notes: Shallots are a mild allium with a blend of garlic and onion flavor, often used in dressings and delicate sauces.

Vegetables.name: peas
Vegetables.storage: Keep frozen or refrigerated; use quickly if fresh.
Vegetables.notes: Peas are small green legumes eaten fresh or frozen and used in soups, salads, and side dishes.

Vegetables.name: potato
Vegetables.storage: Store in a cool, dark place away from onions.
Vegetables.notes: Potatoes are starchy tubers used in countless savory dishes, known for their versatility and comfort food status.

Vegetables.name: radish
Vegetables.storage: Refrigerate in a produce bag or container.
Vegetables.notes: Radishes are spicy, crunchy root vegetables typically eaten raw or pickled, often added to salads and tacos.

Vegetables.name: spinach
Vegetables.storage: Refrigerate in a dry bag or container with paper towel.
Vegetables.notes: Spinach is a leafy green high in iron, fiber, and vitamins, used in salads or cooked dishes.

Vegetables.name: squash
Vegetables.storage: Store in a cool, dark place; refrigerate once cut.
Vegetables.notes: Squash includes many varieties of soft- and hard-skinned gourds, used in both savory and sweet dishes.

Vegetables.name: sweet potato
Vegetables.storage: Store in a cool, dark, well-ventilated place.
Vegetables.notes: Sweet potatoes are orange-fleshed tubers with a sweet flavor, rich in fiber and vitamin A.

Vegetables.name: tomato
Vegetables.storage: Store at room temperature until ripe, then refrigerate.
Vegetables.notes: Tomatoes are juicy fruits commonly used as vegetables, key in sauces, salads, and cooked dishes.

Vegetables.name: turnip
Vegetables.storage: Store in a cool, dark place; refrigerate after cutting.
Vegetables.notes: Turnips are round, white and purple root vegetables with a mild flavor, used in soups and roasts.

Vegetables.name: zucchini
Vegetables.storage: Refrigerate in a bag for best texture and shelf life.
Vegetables.notes: Zucchini is a summer squash with mild flavor and high water content, used in savory and baked dishes.

Fruits.name: apple
Fruits.storage: Store in a cool, dry place or refrigerate to extend shelf life.
Fruits.notes: Apples are crisp, sweet to tart fruits widely used fresh or cooked in desserts and savory dishes.

Fruits.name: apricot
Fruits.storage: Keep at room temperature until ripe, then refrigerate to prolong freshness.
Fruits.notes: Apricots are small, soft fruits with a sweet-tart flavor, often dried or used fresh.

Fruits.name: banana
Fruits.storage: Store at room temperature; refrigerate if very ripe to slow browning.
Fruits.notes: Bananas are sweet tropical fruits with soft flesh, commonly eaten fresh or used in baking.

Fruits.name: blackberries
Fruits.storage: Refrigerate and consume quickly; freeze for longer storage.
Fruits.notes: Blackberries are dark, juicy berries with a sweet-tart flavor, popular in desserts and jams.

Fruits.name: blueberries
Fruits.storage: Keep refrigerated; freeze for longer storage.
Fruits.notes: Blueberries are sweet, nutrient-rich berries widely used fresh or in baked goods.

Fruits.name: cherry
Fruits.storage: Refrigerate and consume quickly; freeze for long-term storage.
Fruits.notes: Cherries are small, round stone fruits, sweet or tart, popular fresh or in desserts.

Fruits.name: coconut
Fruits.storage: Store in a cool, dry place; refrigerate shredded or milk products.
Fruits.notes: Coconuts provide versatile meat, water, and milk used in many tropical cuisines.

Fruits.name: cranberries
Fruits.storage: Keep refrigerated; freeze for longer shelf life.
Fruits.notes: Cranberries are tart berries often used in sauces and dried snacks.

Fruits.name: date
Fruits.storage: Store in a cool, dry place; refrigerate to extend freshness.
Fruits.notes: Dates are sweet, chewy fruits popular in Middle Eastern cuisines and snacks.

Fruits.name: fig
Fruits.storage: Refrigerate fresh figs; store dried figs in a cool, dry place.
Fruits.notes: Figs are sweet fruits eaten fresh or dried, often used in baking and snacks.

Fruits.name: grapes
Fruits.storage: Keep refrigerated; freeze for longer storage.
Fruits.notes: Grapes are sweet berries eaten fresh or dried as raisins, used in juices and wines.

Fruits.name: grapefruit
Fruits.storage: Store in the refrigerator for best freshness.
Fruits.notes: Grapefruits are large citrus fruits with a tart, slightly bitter flavor.

Fruits.name: kiwi
Fruits.storage: Keep refrigerated for best shelf life and flavor.
Fruits.notes: Kiwis are small, fuzzy fruits with a tart-sweet flavor and bright green flesh.

Fruits.name: lemon
Fruits.storage: Store in a cool, dry place or refrigerate to extend shelf life.
Fruits.notes: Lemons are bright yellow citrus fruits used for juice, zest, and flavoring.

Fruits.name: lime
Fruits.storage: Keep refrigerated for best freshness.
Fruits.notes: Limes are small green citrus fruits known for their tart juice and zest.

Fruits.name: mango
Fruits.storage: Store at room temperature until ripe, then refrigerate.
Fruits.notes: Mangoes are sweet, tropical stone fruits with juicy flesh often used fresh or in beverages.

Fruits.name: melon
Fruits.storage: Keep refrigerated after cutting to maintain freshness.
Fruits.notes: Melons are sweet, juicy fruits with various varieties like cantaloupe and honeydew.

Fruits.name: nectarine
Fruits.storage: Store at room temperature until ripe, then refrigerate.
Fruits.notes: Nectarines are smooth-skinned stone fruits similar to peaches with sweet flavor.

Fruits.name: orange
Fruits.storage: Store in a cool, dry place or refrigerate for extended freshness.
Fruits.notes: Oranges are sweet citrus fruits commonly consumed fresh or as juice.

Fruits.name: papaya
Fruits.storage: Store at room temperature until ripe; refrigerate afterward.
Fruits.notes: Papayas are tropical fruits with sweet orange flesh and edible seeds.

Fruits.name: peach
Fruits.storage: Store at room temperature until ripe; refrigerate after ripening.
Fruits.notes: Peaches are juicy stone fruits with fuzzy skin and sweet flesh.

Fruits.name: pear
Fruits.storage: Store at room temperature until ripe, then refrigerate.
Fruits.notes: Pears are sweet pomes with a soft texture, eaten fresh or cooked.

Fruits.name: pineapple
Fruits.storage: Store at room temperature until ripe, then refrigerate cut pieces.
Fruits.notes: Pineapples are tropical fruits with sweet, tangy flesh often used fresh or cooked.

Fruits.name: plum
Fruits.storage: Store at room temperature until ripe; refrigerate after ripening.
Fruits.notes: Plums are sweet stone fruits eaten fresh or dried as prunes.

Fruits.name: pomegranate
Fruits.storage: Store in a cool, dry place or refrigerate after cutting.
Fruits.notes: Pomegranates are red fruits filled with juicy seeds known for their tart flavor.

Fruits.name: raspberries
Fruits.storage: Refrigerate and consume quickly; freeze for longer storage.
Fruits.notes: Raspberries are delicate, sweet-tart berries used fresh or in preserves.

Fruits.name: strawberries
Fruits.storage: Refrigerate and consume quickly; freeze for longer storage.
Fruits.notes: Strawberries are sweet, bright red berries commonly eaten fresh or in desserts.

Fruits.name: watermelon
Fruits.storage: Keep refrigerated after cutting to maintain freshness.
Fruits.notes: Watermelons are large, juicy melons popular in summer with sweet, watery flesh.

Grains & Legumes.name: barley
Grains & Legumes.storage: Store in a cool, dry place in an airtight container.
Grains & Legumes.notes: Barley is a versatile whole grain often used in soups, salads, and side dishes.

Grains & Legumes.name: black beans
Grains & Legumes.storage: Store dried beans in airtight containers in a cool, dry place; refrigerate cooked beans.
Grains & Legumes.notes: Black beans are small, shiny beans popular in Latin American cuisines.

Grains & Legumes.name: brown rice
Grains & Legumes.storage: Store in airtight containers in a cool, dry place.
Grains & Legumes.notes: Brown rice is whole grain rice with the bran layer intact, providing more fiber than white rice.

Grains & Legumes.name: buckwheat
Grains & Legumes.storage: Store in a cool, dry place in airtight containers.
Grains & Legumes.notes: Buckwheat is a gluten-free pseudocereal with a strong, nutty flavor.

Grains & Legumes.name: bulgur
Grains & Legumes.storage: Store in airtight containers in a cool, dry place.
Grains & Legumes.notes: Bulgur is cracked wheat that is parboiled and dried, commonly used in Middle Eastern dishes.

Grains & Legumes.name: chickpeas
Grains & Legumes.storage: Store dried chickpeas in airtight containers; refrigerate cooked.
Grains & Legumes.notes: Chickpeas are versatile legumes used in hummus, stews, and salads.

Grains & Legumes.name: farro
Grains & Legumes.storage: Store in a cool, dry place in airtight containers.
Grains & Legumes.notes: Farro is an ancient wheat grain with a chewy texture and nutty flavor.

Grains & Legumes.name: green lentils
Grains & Legumes.storage: Store dried lentils in airtight containers in a cool, dry place.
Grains & Legumes.notes: Green lentils hold their shape well and have a mild, earthy flavor.

Grains & Legumes.name: kidney beans
Grains & Legumes.storage: Store dried beans in airtight containers; refrigerate cooked beans.
Grains & Legumes.notes: Kidney beans are large, reddish beans commonly used in chili and other hearty dishes.

Grains & Legumes.name: oats
Grains & Legumes.storage: Store in a cool, dry place in airtight containers.
Grains & Legumes.notes: Oats are whole grains commonly used for breakfast cereals and baking.

Grains & Legumes.name: pinto beans
Grains & Legumes.storage: Store dried beans in airtight containers; refrigerate cooked beans.
Grains & Legumes.notes: Pinto beans are medium-sized beans common in Mexican and Southwestern cuisine.

Grains & Legumes.name: quinoa
Grains & Legumes.storage: Store in a cool, dry place in an airtight container.
Grains & Legumes.notes: Quinoa is a gluten-free pseudograin known for its high protein content and versatility.

Grains & Legumes.name: red lentils
Grains & Legumes.storage: Store dried lentils in airtight containers in a cool, dry place.
Grains & Legumes.notes: Red lentils cook quickly and tend to break down, making them ideal for soups and purees.

Grains & Legumes.name: soybeans
Grains & Legumes.storage: Store dried soybeans in a cool, dry place; refrigerate cooked soybeans.
Grains & Legumes.notes: Soybeans are versatile legumes used fresh as edamame or processed into tofu and soy milk.

Grains & Legumes.name: white rice
Grains & Legumes.storage: Store in airtight containers in a cool, dry place.
Grains & Legumes.notes: White rice is polished rice with the bran and germ removed, resulting in a softer texture and longer shelf life.

Grains & Legumes.name: wild rice
Grains & Legumes.storage: Store in airtight containers in a cool, dry place.
Grains & Legumes.notes: Wild rice is an aquatic grass seed with a distinctive nutty flavor and chewy texture.

Dairy & Eggs.name: butter
Dairy & Eggs.storage: Refrigerate; freeze for long term storage.
Dairy & Eggs.notes: Butter is a dairy fat used for cooking, baking, and flavoring.

Dairy & Eggs.name: cheddar cheese
Dairy & Eggs.storage: Refrigerate; keep wrapped to avoid drying.
Dairy & Eggs.notes: Cheddar is a firm, often sharp cheese used widely in cooking and sandwiches.

Dairy & Eggs.name: cream cheese
Dairy & Eggs.notes: Cream cheese is a soft, mild cheese often used as a spread or in desserts.

Dairy & Eggs.name: egg
Dairy & Eggs.notes: Eggs are a common cooking and baking ingredient rich in protein.

Dairy & Eggs.name: goat cheese
Dairy & Eggs.notes: Goat cheese is a soft, tangy cheese used in salads, spreads, and baking.

Dairy & Eggs.name: half and half
Dairy & Eggs.notes: Half and half is a mixture of milk and cream commonly used in coffee and cooking.

Dairy & Eggs.name: milk
Dairy & Eggs.notes: Milk is a nutrient-rich liquid dairy product used widely in cooking and beverages.

Dairy & Eggs.name: mozzarella
Dairy & Eggs.notes: Mozzarella is a soft cheese popular for melting on pizzas and salads.

Dairy & Eggs.name: parmesan
Dairy & Eggs.notes: Parmesan is a hard, aged cheese with a sharp, savory flavor.

Dairy & Eggs.name: sour cream
Dairy & Eggs.notes: Sour cream is a fermented dairy product with a tangy flavor used in cooking and dips.

Dairy & Eggs.name: whipping cream
Dairy & Eggs.notes: Whipping cream is a high-fat dairy cream used for whipping and enriching dishes.

Dairy & Eggs.name: yogurt
Dairy & Eggs.storage: Refrigerate and consume by expiration date.
Dairy & Eggs.notes: Yogurt is a fermented dairy product with probiotic benefits.

Meat & Seafood.name: bacon
Meat & Seafood.storage: Refrigerate and use by expiration; freeze for longer storage.
Meat & Seafood.notes: Bacon is cured and smoked pork belly, commonly sliced and cooked until crispy.

Meat & Seafood.name: beef
Meat & Seafood.storage: Refrigerate fresh beef; freeze for longer storage.
Meat & Seafood.notes: Beef is meat from cattle, available in various cuts with rich flavor.

Meat & Seafood.name: chicken breast
Meat & Seafood.storage: Refrigerate fresh; freeze for longer storage.
Meat & Seafood.notes: Chicken breast is a lean cut of poultry widely used in various dishes.

Meat & Seafood.name: chicken broth
Meat & Seafood.storage: Refrigerate after opening; freeze for long-term storage. Shelf-stable when unopened.
Meat & Seafood.notes: Chicken broth is a savory liquid made from simmered chicken and aromatics, often used as a cooking base.

Meat & Seafood.name: chicken thigh
Meat & Seafood.storage: Refrigerate fresh; freeze for longer storage.
Meat & Seafood.notes: Chicken thigh is a flavorful cut of poultry with more fat than breast.

Meat & Seafood.name: ground beef
Meat & Seafood.storage: Refrigerate or freeze promptly after purchase.
Meat & Seafood.notes: Ground beef is minced beef used in burgers, sauces, and more.

Meat & Seafood.name: ground pork
Meat & Seafood.storage: Refrigerate or freeze promptly after purchase.
Meat & Seafood.notes: Ground pork is minced pork commonly used in sausages and stir-fries.

Meat & Seafood.name: ground turkey
Meat & Seafood.storage: Refrigerate or freeze promptly after purchase.
Meat & Seafood.notes: Ground turkey is lean ground poultry used as a lower-fat substitute for beef.

Meat & Seafood.name: ham
Meat & Seafood.notes: Ham is cured pork, available sliced or whole, often smoked or cooked.

Meat & Seafood.name: lamb
Meat & Seafood.storage: Refrigerate or freeze promptly after purchase.
Meat & Seafood.notes: Lamb is meat from young sheep, tender and flavorful.

Meat & Seafood.name: pork chop
Meat & Seafood.storage: Refrigerate or freeze promptly after purchase.
Meat & Seafood.notes: Pork chops are cuts from the loin of the pig, tender and lean.

Meat & Seafood.name: pork shoulder
Meat & Seafood.storage: Refrigerate or freeze promptly after purchase.
Meat & Seafood.notes: Pork shoulder is a fatty, flavorful cut ideal for slow cooking and pulled pork.

Meat & Seafood.name: salmon
Meat & Seafood.storage: Refrigerate fresh; freeze for longer storage.
Meat & Seafood.notes: Salmon is a popular fatty fish prized for its flavor and omega-3s.

Meat & Seafood.name: sausage
Meat & Seafood.storage: Refrigerate and use quickly; freeze for longer storage.
Meat & Seafood.notes: Sausage is ground meat mixed with spices, typically formed into links or bulk.

Meat & Seafood.name: shrimp
Meat & Seafood.storage: Refrigerate fresh; freeze for longer storage.
Meat & Seafood.notes: Shrimp are small shellfish enjoyed in a variety of cuisines.

Meat & Seafood.name: steak
Meat & Seafood.storage: Refrigerate fresh; freeze for longer storage.
Meat & Seafood.notes: Steak is a thick cut of beef known for tenderness and flavor.

Meat & Seafood.name: tilapia
Meat & Seafood.storage: Refrigerate fresh; freeze for longer storage.
Meat & Seafood.notes: Tilapia is a mild-flavored freshwater fish widely farmed for food.

Meat & Seafood.name: tuna
Meat & Seafood.storage: Refrigerate fresh; freeze for longer storage.
Meat & Seafood.notes: Tuna is a firm, meaty fish popular grilled or canned.

Seasonings & Spices.name: basil
Seasonings & Spices.storage: Store fresh basil in the refrigerator wrapped in a damp paper towel. Dried basil should be stored in a cool, dark place.
Seasonings & Spices.notes: Basil is a fragrant herb popular in Mediterranean and Italian cooking.

Seasonings & Spices.name: black pepper
Seasonings & Spices.storage: Keep peppercorns or ground pepper in an airtight container in a cool, dry place.
Seasonings & Spices.notes: Black pepper is the most common spice worldwide, used to add heat and flavor.

Seasonings & Spices.name: cayenne pepper
Seasonings & Spices.storage: Store in airtight container away from heat and light.
Seasonings & Spices.notes: Cayenne pepper adds strong heat and vibrant color to dishes.

Seasonings & Spices.name: chili powder
Seasonings & Spices.storage: Store in airtight container away from heat and light.
Seasonings & Spices.notes: Chili powder is a blend of spices used for a smoky, spicy flavor.

Seasonings & Spices.name: cilantro
Seasonings & Spices.storage: Wrap fresh cilantro in damp paper towel and store in fridge to keep fresh longer.
Seasonings & Spices.notes: Cilantro is a pungent herb widely used in Latin American and Asian cuisines.

Seasonings & Spices.name: cinnamon
Seasonings & Spices.storage: Store in airtight container away from heat and light.
Seasonings & Spices.notes: Cinnamon is a warm, sweet spice used in baking and savory dishes.

Seasonings & Spices.name: cloves
Seasonings & Spices.storage: Store whole or ground cloves in airtight container away from light and moisture.
Seasonings & Spices.notes: Cloves have a strong, aromatic flavor used in baking and cooking.

Seasonings & Spices.name: coriander
Seasonings & Spices.storage: Store in airtight container away from heat and moisture.
Seasonings & Spices.notes: Coriander seeds have a warm, citrusy flavor used in many spice blends.

Seasonings & Spices.name: cumin
Seasonings & Spices.storage: Store in airtight container away from heat and light.
Seasonings & Spices.notes: Cumin is a strong, earthy spice essential in many cuisines worldwide.

Seasonings & Spices.name: dill
Seasonings & Spices.storage: Store dried dill in airtight container away from light and moisture.
Seasonings & Spices.notes: Dill has a fresh, slightly tangy flavor used in pickling and salads.

Seasonings & Spices.name: fennel
Seasonings & Spices.storage: Store fennel seeds in airtight container away from heat and moisture.
Seasonings & Spices.notes: Fennel seeds have a sweet, licorice-like flavor used in cooking and baking.

Seasonings & Spices.name: garlic powder
Seasonings & Spices.storage: Store in airtight container away from moisture and light.
Seasonings & Spices.notes: Garlic powder is a convenient alternative to fresh garlic with concentrated flavor.

Seasonings & Spices.name: ginger
Seasonings & Spices.storage: Store ground ginger in airtight container away from heat and moisture.
Seasonings & Spices.notes: Ginger adds a warm, spicy flavor to both sweet and savory dishes.

Seasonings & Spices.name: nutmeg
Seasonings & Spices.storage: Store in airtight container away from heat and moisture.
Seasonings & Spices.notes: Nutmeg is a warm, aromatic spice used in baking and savory dishes.

Seasonings & Spices.name: oregano
Seasonings & Spices.storage: Store dried oregano in airtight container away from light and moisture.
Seasonings & Spices.notes: Oregano is a pungent herb popular in Mediterranean cooking.

Seasonings & Spices.name: paprika
Seasonings & Spices.storage: Store in airtight container away from heat and light.
Seasonings & Spices.notes: Paprika is a mild spice made from ground peppers, often smoked.

Seasonings & Spices.name: parsley
Seasonings & Spices.storage: Store fresh parsley wrapped in damp paper towel in fridge.
Seasonings & Spices.notes: Parsley is a mild, fresh herb used widely as garnish and seasoning.

Seasonings & Spices.name: red pepper flakes
Seasonings & Spices.storage: Store in airtight container away from heat and light.
Seasonings & Spices.notes: Red pepper flakes add heat and texture to dishes.

Seasonings & Spices.name: rosemary
Seasonings & Spices.storage: Store dried rosemary in airtight container away from light and moisture.
Seasonings & Spices.notes: Rosemary is a fragrant herb used in roasting and grilling.

Seasonings & Spices.name: sage
Seasonings & Spices.storage: Store dried sage in airtight container away from heat and moisture.
Seasonings & Spices.notes: Sage has a strong, earthy flavor used in savory dishes.

Seasonings & Spices.name: salt
Seasonings & Spices.storage: Store in a dry place.
Seasonings & Spices.notes: Salt is a universal seasoning essential in cooking.

Seasonings & Spices.name: thyme
Seasonings & Spices.storage: Store dried thyme in airtight container away from light and moisture.
Seasonings & Spices.notes: Thyme is a versatile herb used in many cuisines.

Seasonings & Spices.name: turmeric
Seasonings & Spices.storage: Store in airtight container away from heat and light.
Seasonings & Spices.notes: Turmeric is a bright yellow spice with a warm, earthy flavor and health benefits.

Seasonings & Spices.name: vanilla extract
Seasonings & Spices.storage: Store in a cool, dark place.
Seasonings & Spices.notes: Vanilla extract is a common flavoring used in baking and desserts.

Baking Ingredients.name: baking powder
Baking Ingredients.storage: Store in a cool, dry place in an airtight container.
Baking Ingredients.notes: Baking powder is a chemical leavening agent used in baked goods to create rise.

Baking Ingredients.name: baking soda
Baking Ingredients.storage: Store in a cool, dry place away from moisture.
Baking Ingredients.notes: Baking soda is a pure chemical leavening agent used with acids in recipes.

Baking Ingredients.name: brown sugar
Baking Ingredients.storage: Store in airtight container to prevent drying out.
Baking Ingredients.notes: Brown sugar contains molasses giving it moisture and a richer flavor than white sugar.

Baking Ingredients.name: cornstarch
Baking Ingredients.storage: Store in a cool, dry place in an airtight container.
Baking Ingredients.notes: Cornstarch is a fine powder used as a thickener in cooking and baking.

Baking Ingredients.name: flour
Baking Ingredients.storage: Store in a cool, dry place in airtight container to prevent bugs and moisture.
Baking Ingredients.notes: Flour is the primary base for most baked goods and thickening.

Baking Ingredients.name: honey
Baking Ingredients.storage: Store in a sealed container at room temperature. Crystallization is natural.
Baking Ingredients.notes: Honey is a natural sweetener with floral flavors and preservative qualities.

Baking Ingredients.name: molasses
Baking Ingredients.storage: Store in a cool, dry place away from light.
Baking Ingredients.notes: Molasses is a thick, dark syrup byproduct of sugar refining with a robust flavor.

Baking Ingredients.name: powdered sugar
Baking Ingredients.storage: Store in airtight container to prevent clumping.
Baking Ingredients.notes: Powdered sugar is finely ground sugar with a bit of cornstarch added to prevent clumping.

Baking Ingredients.name: sugar
Baking Ingredients.storage: Store in airtight container to prevent clumping and contamination.
Baking Ingredients.notes: Sugar is a basic sweetener essential for baking and cooking.

Baking Ingredients.name: vanilla extract
Baking Ingredients.storage: Store in cool, dark place away from heat.
Baking Ingredients.notes: Vanilla extract is a popular flavoring used in baking and desserts.

Baking Ingredients.name: yeast
Baking Ingredients.storage: Store in refrigerator or freezer to maintain potency.
Baking Ingredients.notes: Yeast is a living leavening agent used for bread and other fermented doughs.

Oils & Vinegars.name: apple cider vinegar
Oils & Vinegars.storage: Store in a cool, dark place away from heat.
Oils & Vinegars.notes: Apple cider vinegar is a popular vinegar with a fruity, tangy flavor.

Oils & Vinegars.name: balsamic vinegar
Oils & Vinegars.storage: Store in a cool, dark place.
Oils & Vinegars.notes: Balsamic vinegar is a dark, sweet vinegar often used in dressings and reductions.

Oils & Vinegars.name: canola oil
Oils & Vinegars.storage: Store in a cool, dark place away from heat and light.
Oils & Vinegars.notes: Canola oil is a neutral-flavored oil with a high smoke point.

Oils & Vinegars.name: coconut oil
Oils & Vinegars.storage: Store in a cool, dark place; solidifies below 76°F (24°C).
Oils & Vinegars.notes: Coconut oil is a tropical oil with a distinctive flavor and solid at room temperature.

Oils & Vinegars.name: olive oil
Oils & Vinegars.storage: Store in a cool, dark place away from heat and light.
Oils & Vinegars.notes: Olive oil is a staple Mediterranean oil with a distinctive flavor profile.

Oils & Vinegars.name: rice vinegar
Oils & Vinegars.storage: Store in a cool, dark place.
Oils & Vinegars.notes: Rice vinegar is a mild vinegar commonly used in Asian cuisine.

Oils & Vinegars.name: sesame oil
Oils & Vinegars.storage: Store in a cool, dark place, refrigerate after opening.
Oils & Vinegars.notes: Sesame oil is prized for its rich, nutty flavor and aroma, especially toasted varieties.

Oils & Vinegars.name: vegetable oil
Oils & Vinegars.storage: Store in a cool, dark place.
Oils & Vinegars.notes: Vegetable oil is a neutral-flavored oil used in many cooking applications.

Oils & Vinegars.name: white vinegar
Oils & Vinegars.storage: Store in a cool, dark place.
Oils & Vinegars.notes: White vinegar is a clear, sharp vinegar commonly used in cooking and cleaning.

Oils & Vinegars.name: barbecue sauce
Oils & Vinegars.storage: Refrigerate after opening.
Oils & Vinegars.notes: Barbecue sauce is a flavorful sauce often used for grilling and dipping.

Oils & Vinegars.name: hot sauce
Oils & Vinegars.storage: Store in refrigerator after opening.
Oils & Vinegars.notes: Hot sauce adds heat and flavor to dishes.

Oils & Vinegars.name: jam
Oils & Vinegars.storage: Refrigerate after opening.
Oils & Vinegars.notes: Jam is a sweet fruit spread made by cooking fruit with sugar.

Oils & Vinegars.name: ketchup
Oils & Vinegars.storage: Refrigerate after opening.
Oils & Vinegars.notes: Ketchup is a sweet and tangy tomato-based sauce popular worldwide.

Oils & Vinegars.name: mayonnaise
Oils & Vinegars.storage: Refrigerate after opening.
Oils & Vinegars.notes: Mayonnaise is an emulsified sauce made from oil, egg yolks, and vinegar or lemon juice.

Oils & Vinegars.name: mustard
Oils & Vinegars.storage: Refrigerate after opening.
Oils & Vinegars.notes: Mustard is a pungent condiment made from ground mustard seeds and vinegar.

Oils & Vinegars.name: peanut butter
Oils & Vinegars.storage: Store in a cool, dry place; refrigerate after opening for natural types.
Oils & Vinegars.notes: Peanut butter is a popular nut spread with protein and healthy fats.

Oils & Vinegars.name: soy sauce
Oils & Vinegars.storage: Store in a cool, dark place; refrigerate after opening.
Oils & Vinegars.notes: Soy sauce is a salty, fermented sauce used extensively in Asian cuisine.

Oils & Vinegars.name: sriracha
Oils & Vinegars.storage: Refrigerate after opening.
Oils & Vinegars.notes: Sriracha is a popular spicy chili sauce with garlic flavor.

Oils & Vinegars.name: tomato paste
Oils & Vinegars.storage: Refrigerate after opening.
Oils & Vinegars.notes: Tomato paste is a concentrated tomato product used to add depth and color.

Oils & Vinegars.name: tomato sauce
Oils & Vinegars.storage: Refrigerate after opening.
Oils & Vinegars.notes: Tomato sauce is a cooked tomato product used as a base for many dishes.

Oils & Vinegars.name: vinegar
Oils & Vinegars.storage: Store in a cool, dark place.
Oils & Vinegars.notes: Vinegar is a sour liquid used widely for flavoring and preservation.

Oils & Vinegars.name: worcestershire sauce
Oils & Vinegars.storage: Refrigerate after opening.
Oils & Vinegars.notes: Worcestershire sauce is a fermented liquid condiment with complex flavors.

Wines.name: red wine
Wines.storage: Store in a cool, dark place; refrigerate after opening.
Wines.notes: Red wine adds deep flavor and complexity to savory dishes.

Wines.name: white wine
Wines.storage: Store in a cool, dark place; refrigerate after opening.
Wines.notes: White wine is often used to brighten dishes with acidity and subtle fruitiness.

Wines.name: sherry
Wines.storage: Store in a cool, dark place; refrigerate after opening.
Wines.notes: Sherry is a fortified wine with distinctive nutty and sweet flavors.

Wines.name: marsala wine
Wines.storage: Store in a cool, dark place; refrigerate after opening.
Wines.notes: Marsala is a fortified wine often used in Italian cooking, especially for savory and sweet dishes.

Miscellaneous.name: water
Miscellaneous.storage: Store in a clean container at room temperature or refrigerated.
Miscellaneous.notes: Water is essential for cooking and hydration; used in virtually every recipe.

Miscellaneous.name: bay leaf
Miscellaneous.storage: Store in a cool, dry place away from sunlight.
Miscellaneous.notes: Bay leaves add a subtle aroma and depth to soups, stews, and sauces; typically removed before serving.
